item.description:
Harvard Thinks Green 2: LINK

 

:: :: ::

 

SEPTEMBER 18 @7pm

Sanders Theatre, Memorial Hall

 

:: :: ::

 

For the second consecutive year, Harvard's Office for Sustainability will bring 6 all-star Harvard environmental faculty to Sanders Theatre in Memorial Hall to present their big green ideas for 10 minutes each, at the Harvard Thinks Green 2 event.

Don't miss your chance to attend this event featuring Former Obama advisor and Assitant Professor of Public Policy at the Harvard Kennedy School Joseph Aldy, Philip S. Weld Professor of Atmospheric Chemistry at the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences James G. Anderson, Novartis Professor of Leadership and Management at the Harvard Business School Amy Edmondson, Artifical Leaf Inventor and Patterson Rockwood Professor of Energy Daniel Nocera, Assistant Professor of Urban Planning at the Graduate School of Design Joyce Klein Rosenthal, and Sturgis Professor of Geology and Director, Harvard University Center for the Environment Daniel P. Schrag.

For more information about this and other environmental events, click here.

To read all about Harvard Thinks Green 2011 and view video from the event, visit the Harvard Gazette here .
item.name: Harvard Thinks Green 2
